Name: Acrofacial dysostosis Palagonia type
Synonyms_List__c: AFD- Palagonia type, PAFD, Palagonia form of AFD, Palagonia type of acrofacial dysostosis
Disease_Description__c: A very rare form of acrofacial dysostosis, reported in four members of a family from the Sicilian village of Palagonia. The syndrome has characteristics of normal intelligence, shortness of stature, and mild acrofacial dysostosis (malar hypoplasia, micrognathia and webbing of digits with shortening of the fourth metacarpals) associated with oligodontia, normal or high arched palate, aplasia cutis verticis with pili torti, mild cutaneous syndactyly of digits 2-5, webbing of digits and shortening of the fourth metacarpals and unilateral cleft lip.
